page.title: 07Attitudes in Middleton
page.content:
Even tough both young and old complain because the village is so isolated, they all care about it equally and resent any change which would spoil the characteristics of the village. For example, when a sign to warn motorists about cattle was put up in the square many complained. A small brown addition to the sign made the point!
Most people think that the younger ones should be more involved in the running of events and now three youngsters have joined the entertainments committee
Everyone in the village seems to know everyone else's business, which would seem like nosiness to an outsider, but is mainly just friendly concern.
